meanings.sent1: I will retransfer the book to the library tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She decided to retransfer the money to her savings account.
meanings.sent3: After accidentally giving the wrong address, she had to retransfer the package.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to retransfer me to a different time and place.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand could retransfer objects with a flick of his wrist.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring something back.
meanings.sent1: The retransfer of ownership was completed smoothly.
meanings.sent2: He requested a retransfer of the document to the main office.
meanings.sent3: The retransfer of the painting caused quite a commotion in the art world.
meanings.sent4: The retransfer of energy between the two devices was fascinating to watch.
meanings.sent5: The retransfer of memories brought a flood of emotions back to her.
